alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 12:52PM MST until August 14 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Rafael Fire scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 1251 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Rafael Fire scar. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Rafael Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Rafael Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Coconino and Yavapai Counties This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tule Tank Wash, Coffee Creek, Spring Creek, Sycamore Creek, JD Dam Wash and Railroad Draw. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Rafael Fire scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
